I'm excited to start my collection of video game soundtracks. Do you have any tips for caring for vinyl records to ensure they last a long time?

I'm glad that I could help. Here are a few tips for caring for vinyl records to ensure they last a long time:

1. Store your vinyl records upright to prevent warping or bending. 2. Keep your vinyl records in a cool and dry place to avoid damage from heat or moisture. 3. Handle your vinyl records by the edges or center label to avoid fingerprints and scratches. 4. Always use a proper cleaning solution and a soft cloth when cleaning your vinyl records to remove dirt and dust. 5. Invest in a record brush for daily maintenance and use a record cleaning machine periodically for deep cleaning. 6. Always handle your vinyl records with clean hands to avoid adding oils and dirt to the grooves. By following these tips, your vinyl records should stay in excellent condition for a long time, allowing you to enjoy your favorite video game soundtracks for years to come.

Overall, I think that as long as there are passionate fans and talented composers creating amazing music for video games, the interest in video game soundtracks will continue to grow, both as a niche interest and as a more mainstream form of music.
